intro: Hicorius myristiciformis, commonly known as the spurge tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palm-like leaves and yellowish-orange sap. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
